Replies.Reply: You cried all day and left TV on till you were a zombie. But then I zoomed down from heaven through Skylight into Room -
and I was kicking you from the inside, boom boom, and then I shot out onto Rug with my eyes wide open, and you cutted the cord and said "Hello Jack."
Replies.Didascalie: (V.O.) (makes noise of descent, then crash landing)

Replies.Reply: Morning lamp, Morning rug, Morning wardrobe ..
If we don't mind, it doesn't matter.
A birthday cake, like in TV?
I'm not very taller after four.
That's where Red Pen died and we got Black Pen for Sunday Treat.
I'm going to grow and grow till I'm a giant. Look, Ma. Look how big my superpowers are already.
I'm going to be Jack the Giant Giant-Killer and burst out of Skylight into Space with my dog Lucky and boing boing boing between all the planets...
I can read them all but I like when you do.
Our friend Spoon, sings to the moon.
You said a birthday cake for real.
You should ask for candles for Sunday Treat, not dumb jeans.
But Old Nick gets anything, by magic.
Next week when I'm six you better ask for real candles.
Can we have more birthday cake?

There's Room, then Outer Space, then Heaven. Plant is real but not trees. Spiders are real and one time the mosquito that was sucking my blood. But squirrels and dogs are just TV, except Lucky my dog that might be some day. Mountains are too big to be real and the sea.

TV persons are flat and made of colors with red mouths and clothes instead of skin but me and you are real. Old Nick I don't know if he's real, maybe half? Green beans are real and chocolate but not ice cream.
Why Plant doesn't make flowers anymore?
He was an alive thing, he was real!
Mouse can have my food, I'm not hungry.
Mouse is my friend and you splatted him dead.
Mouse lives in a yard in TV?
Why you didn't tell Old Nick it was my birthday?
He said he'd brung me a present.
It might be Lucky my dog.
Ma. Where are we when we're asleep?
But dreams. Do we go into TV for dreaming?
Ma! I think Old Nick lives in TV, like Mouse. That's where he goes when he's not here in Room.
Why the aliens never scream back?
Sorry I came out of Wardrobe.
For, you see, so many out-of-the-
- lately, that Alice had begun to think that very few things indeed were really impossible.
When's Old Nick going to put the power back?
I hope he never comes back not ever.
I don't see any outside side.
No way. Where would they all fit?
Dumbo Ma. That's not a leaf. Leaves are green.
Where's all the stuff you said?
I want to be four again.
She fell down down down the hole.
Room's not stinky.   Only when you do a fart.
I don't believe in your stinky world.

Eggsnake's our longest friend and fanciest. Meltedy Spoon's the best to eat with because he's more blobbier. Labyrinth is the twistiest and she hides things so I don't know where. Toilet's the best at disappearing poo. Lamp's the brightest except when the powercut.
You're the best at reading and songs and lots except if you're having a Gone Day. I'm the best at drawing and jumping and growing and nearly everything.
Bad Tooth? Can I have it?
When Old Nick comes back, I'm going to kick him in the butt.
We could wait till he's asleep and kill him dead.
The Grandma and the Grandpa could come.
Maybe next year when I'm six.
Our bags are too small for being dead in.
I don't want to be dead.
What if Old Nick unwraps me?
It's in here so I don't lose it.
Old Nick. But that's not his name.
I bit me by accident. And the, the, the -
The hard of the street. I jumped and smasheded my knee.
We don't know to open the door.
He putted me - I wasn't meant to be alive.
Jump when it Slows Down. But I couldn't, I was all...
The third time, I got banged.
The third slow, everything went sideways -
- and then it stopped and I jumped and -
Can we go to Bed now?
Are we sick for real or pretend?
I wetted the bed ... before. I'm sorry.
Bath before Bed, that's the rule.

I've been in the world nineteen hours. I've seen pancakes and stairs and a cat and windows and hundreds of cars and birds and police and doctors and Grandma and Grandpa, and persons with different faces and bigness and smells talking all at the same time. The world's like all TV planets on at the same time so I don't know which what to look and listen. Doors and doors and behind all the door there's another inside and another outside and things happen-happen-
Where's ice cream in the hammock?
How long do we have to stay here?
I had a dog called Lucky. But he's not real.
I got a truck but it broke and Ma got me a cake.
Show me more when you were young.
I know Old Nick is in jail.
Why do you look like that?
I want Dylan. I want Dylan now.You said.
I don't like you in the world!

There's so much of place in the world, there's less time because the time has to be spread extra thin over all the places like butter, so all the persons say hurry up, let's get going, pick up the pace, finish up now. Ma was in a hurry to go boing up to heaven but she forgot me, Dumbo Ma, so the aliens threw her back down craaaaaaaash and broke her.
I pick. I pick for both of us.
Sure. I did it before. In Room.
Lots of things. I miss it sometimes.
Uh uh, it went every direction all the way to the end. It never finished. And Ma was always there.
I could just go in and tell her about Seamus. Only for a minute. Or I could just look at her.
I want to send it to Ma.
She needs my strong more than me.
You think this will work? Can my strong be her strong too? I'm not really sure if it works that way.
I'm going to play with Aaron now.
When I was four I didn't even know about the world and now me and Ma are going to live in it forever and ever till we're dead.

This is a street in a city in a country called America on the earth that's a blue and green planet always spinning so I don't know why we don't fall off. Then there's Outer Space, and nobody knows where's heaven.
Ma and I have decided that because we don't know what we like we get to try everything.
We have so many things to do.
Can we go back to Room?
This isn't Room. Has it gotten shrinked? Our friends...
It can't really be Room if Door's open.
Guess what we're going to make later.
You always pick that. But I guess it's your birthday.
Too much TV will turn us into zombies ... Anyway, it's time to mark how tall you are.
Sorry, I already asked for jeans for you for Sunday Treat.
You'll be as strong as Samson soon.
Come on, you can read Dylan yourself.
excavator so loves to munch dirt.
Our friend Table... just isn't able.
Our friend Knife runs for his life.
Sorry. I have to ask for stuff we really need that he can get easily.
Try your cake, I bet it's delicioso.
But one day the mermaid finds where the fisherman hid her comb.
So she runs home to the sea.
Of course she takes her Baby Jack with her.
No, he's half-merman. He can breathe air or water, whichever.
... and Edmond swims and swims to the island of Monte Cristo and digs up all the treasure, and ...
They'd bring in germs, bite us in the night.
I swear, he's safe at home with his Ma in the backyard.
Hey, let's make a UFO with this.
You shouldn't hear what he - You're meant to be asleep.
Jack. We can't have a dog. We don't have room -
- space, enough space - cooped up in here with the barking, the scratching...
He's just made-up, in your head, he's not real.
I guess they still can't hear us.
If we had a better diet, maybe...
What are you going to do?
Are you... looking for another job?
Get away from him! Get away!
We have to use them up before they rot. Once we eat we'll feel warmer.
Once he's not mad with me anymore.
You know where he is right now?
On the other side of this wall.
Oh Jack, everything has two sides.
But a wall's like this. And we're on the inside, in Room, and Mouse is on the outside, see?
No, in the world.   It's much closer than Outer Space.
But if we were outside in the world, we would, we'd be looking at the other side of this wall, and Mouse lying in the grass with his Ma. We'd see trees and cars and -
Is it, though? You know when Door opens and the air comes in, the air that smells fresher - that's grass.
But it's not TV. It's the real world we smell. You're so smart, I know you've started wondering.
Where do you think Old Nick gets our food?
There's no magic! Everything we see on TV - it's pictures of real stuff and real people in the world.
No, sorry, not Dora, she's just a picture, but the other ones, with faces like ours - and there's real streets and oceans, dogs, cats -
Just out there, in the world.
On the trees they are but when they fall they rot, like salad, in the fridge, they -.
Well, we can't see them from here because the skylight looks upwards instead of sideways.
Jack. I couldn't explain before, you were too small to understand, so.. I had to make up a story.
But now - it's the opposite of lying, I'm unlying, because now you're five I think you can understand about the world, you have to understand.
You know how Alice wasn't always in Wonderland?
Well, I'm like Alice. I wasn't always in Room.
I used to be a little girl called Joy. I lived-
- with my mom and dad. You'd call them Grandma and Grandpa.
The house where we lived, with a hammock in the back yard. We used to swing in the hammock and eat ice cream.
It's not TV, Jack. Are you listening?
And then I was nearly grown up, I was seventeen, I was walking to school and -
Still up in heaven. So this guy ran up to me, saying his -
We call him Old Nick, but I don't know his real name. He pretended his dog was sick, he seemed really -
There was no dog. It was just a trick to get me into his truck. Old Nick stole me.
You need to hear this one. He put me in his garden shed.
Here. Room's the shed. He's the only one with the code - secret numbers to open the door. I've been locked in here for seven years. Do you understand?
Jack, the world. You wouldn't believe how big it is. Room's only a tiny stinky piece of it.
Totally real. I had a pet turtle.
Ah, they're real people playing dress-up, pretending to be people from hundreds of years ago.
One night I stood behind the door with the lid of the toilet tank -
- it used to have a lid, it was the heaviest thing in Room. When he came in I tried to smash it down on his head. But I messed up, Jack.
Yes we could, but then we'd have no more food - and we wouldn't know the code, on the door, to get out.
They don't know where we are, Jack.
Jack, I want you to listen to me.
You're old enough now and we can't wait any longer ... Jack you are going to help me trick Old Nick like Jack in the stories is always tricking the giant.
I'm going to make your face so scorching hot that Old Nick will take you to the hospital in his truck, and the minute you get there you'll tell the doctors, 'Help!
I'll write you a note to give them.
I won't be in the hospital, I'll be here.
He won't take us both. You'll go first, just to the hospital so you can tell the police, and then...
We'll be free. Go on hikes, see birds. Ride in cars and trains and planes. I'll teach you to swim.
I'm going to tell him the powercut made you so cold, you got a fever.
I'm your Ma. Sometimes I have to pick for both of us.
You need to feel hot when he touches you.
Crying's good, it makes you look sicker.
And stay floppy, remember? You're too weak to move or say a word.
Remember when you get to the hospital you give them the note.
See, that's a bit of me you have with you all the time.
I couldn't keep him warm, and now he's burning.
I've tried, he pukes them back up.
He's only five! Dehydrated, temperature this high, he could go into convulsions any minute.
Tomorrow night? You have to take him to the ER right now.
So Edmond pulls his friend's body out of the bag and hides it, and he climbs into the bag, and lies super still until the guards come.
And that's what you're going to do.
See? It's even tricksier than pretending to be sick: this time you're going to be dead.
Rug's going to be the bag, see?
Pretending to be dead, that's all.
He's going to carry you outside, all rolled up in Rug, and he'll put you in the back of his pick-up and drive somewhere to bury you -
It's OK. You'll wriggle free and jump out of the truck. You'll -
Come on, Jack, let's try rolling you up.
Please Jack, try just for a minute.
Excellent! He'll pick you up - stay stiff as you can.
Ok, it's too many turns. Up, up.
If you panic, Old Nick will hear that you're alive, and he'll be mad.
You did it! You're the banana!
That's OK. I brought you here to Room. I didn't mean to but I did, and I've always been so glad. And now it's my job to get you out.
Wait till the truck slows down at the first stop sign - if you jump when it's going fast you might -
So Truck, Wriggle Out, Jump when it Slows Down...
Jump, Run, then shout to Somebody and show them the Note.
Anybody - the first person you see.
You got Bad Tooth in your pocket?
The world. Living in the hammock house with your Grandma and Grandpa...
One evening as the sun went down and the jungle fire was burning, down the track came a hobo hikin', and he said "Boys, I'm not turning.
He got worse in the night.
Not here. I'd feel him. I'd know.
Drive him somewhere nice, somewhere with lots of trees.
Keep him wrapped up. Swear you won't even look at him with your filthy eyes.
We can do anything. They'll find us somewhere to sleep soon.
Good morning sleepy head. I was waiting so long for you to wake I fell back asleep.
Same one, just a different bit.
We're not sick. We're the opposite of sick.
Not long. Grandma saw us last night and she'll take us when they say we're OK.
He was away at work but he's getting on a plane to come home.
Don't worry about that. Someone will wash it. Come on, we have to get ready.
Do you like it? There's one for you, too.
There are going to be so many treats, not just on Sundays.
No, he will never, ever come again.
There aren't any rules now, Jack.

Replies.Reply: Thanks for the offer but we're going to go home.
He says he's real, not plastic.
Jack, Jack it's OK. This is your Grandma and Grandpa.
Leave them, Jack, you'll get used to them.
Whoa. This is not what I thought was happening.
He has no idea what we've been through. Nothing could compare to that.
I told him we're going home.
OK, this is a lot of stuff.
Just wait a moment. We'll go inside in a moment.
I need to go back now, anyway.
I know, I'm watching it right now.
Jack, Grandma's asking if you'd like something to drink.
They're from people saying they're happy that we're safe and back home.
Mom, what have you done with the hammock?
You didn't know I could play piano.
Why are you in such a hurry?
You haven't said one word to Jack.
Yes we do. Look at him.
Come on, Jack. Time for bed.
Hey Jack, you want play with your new toys?
Jack, you have all those colors.
I already gave all this information to the last person.
Hold on ... I don't understand the words you are using, so why do you keep repeating them?
I have done that three times already.
Leo, please don't ever take Jack outside again unless you know what you're doing. He can be seriously hurt by the sun.
He has never had any UV. This is serious stuff, OK?
Me and Stacy Benton and Heather Noel and Laura Sullivan. That's how people did their hair. We were the relay team. I was the anchor. I was fast. We did track together.
Real track. On a field. We were fast. Best in the district. You know what happened to them?
Exactly. Nothing. They just lived and nothing happened. Look ...
No. I don't want to see any more. I don't want you to look at any more right now. Let's just be quiet for while. Okey dokey?
Do you want to hear something really good?
Hey listen. Old Nick is going to jail for a really long time.
But now he'll be there for ever and ever. And I don't have to see him ever again or talk to the judge or any of those scary things. Isn't that great?
We can stop worrying now and start to do all the things we want.
I'm dressed to go out, that's all.
It's just some clothes and makeup.
Come on, we need to get you ready.
It's not too much for me. I need to go out, get some air.
You could have a better attitude, you know.
You could support me in this.
This is too weird, sitting in this car right now.
I'm happy, too. And a little freaked out.
I always liked her even though we never really hung out.
Jack. This way. Just hold my hand.
You're going to be fine. OK?
Come on. If you're good we can get another book, a new one on our way out.
I'm here. OK? Just calm down.
Don't be. This is normal. This is what people do.
Remember your superpowers, alright, have fun. And no whining, OK?
No. I definitely don't want any of these. I'd never wear these.
Are you hungry, Jack? You want something in the food court?
I said if you were good.
No. I said no, so he has to understand.
Jack, you want a Cinnabon? You smell that?
Cinnabon is good. You might like it.
You are being really naughty Jack.
Get the fuck away from him. Get the fuck away.
Jesus Christ. Just buckle it, all right?
That's how it works, all right?
Well maybe I don't like you either!
Jack! Please. Please. I'm begging you, please turn that off.
It reminds me too much of Room. I can't have it.
You've got so many other things to play with. You should try something else.
Come on. Let's look at all your stuff.
Look at all these toys. Most kids would love that stuff. You've barely even looked at them.
It's pretty cool, right? You like it?
He needs something real to do. I'm getting worried about him with the phone.
I don't give him my phone so please don't give him yours.
I just want him to connect to something. You know?
I'm sorry, I don't know what's happening to me. I can't feel anything. Even for ...
Don't judge me. You have no right.
Don't! I can't bear it. I thought this would be heaven, but it's worse. Can you understand that?
No I don't! That's not what I need.
No! That's not what he said. You don't know what he said. That's confidential and you don't even know. Just forget it.
You think you know what's in my head. Trust me, you couldn't handle it.
So you're seeing that every time you look at me? Great.
Yeah, well you seemed to get on OK without me.
Actually, that's exactly what I think.
nice' that day I wouldn't have gone to help him.
This isn't even my house anymore. I don't know what this is.
You know, Jack, we're going to have to move away from here someday.
Thank you. Thank you so much. I hope they all know how much their thoughts and prayers have meant the last few weeks. To our whole family.
He is. He's my life. I never could have survived without him.

I... I didn't think about it. I didn't plan it. When I found out I was pregnant with Jack, it just seemed like a terrible joke. You know? To bring someone into that place, it just seemed so wrong. I was in a very scary frame of mind.
Then, everything was different once Jack came, because he was so beautiful and I had to keep him safe.
A father's a man who loves his kid.
That's not a relationship. Jack's nobody's but mine.
In this whole story, that's the shocking detail?
Is he there? Put him on.
I wish I could. I just need to -
I'll always keep this with me, Jack.

The grapes were way too much, so I got canned pears.
Shoulda told me, I'd have brought him a present.
You need to take more care.

Here we go again. You know instead of complaining maybe you should thank your lucky stars you've got a place like this. Cosy, safe, specially with the kid - no drunk drivers, drug-pushers, perverts...
Your problem is you have no idea about the world of today.
Who pays the power bills? Who pays for everything?
And where do you think the money's going to keep coming from?
Six months I've been laid off, have you had to worry your little head?
What job? There are no damn jobs, Jesus Christ!
Don't think so. You keep him in the closet all day as well as all night? Poor little freak has two heads or something?
Hey Jack. You like candy? Wanna come out and have some candy?
Didn't your Momma ever teach you manners?
Just don't forget where you got him.
You know the drill: not a peep out of you till the door's shut.
Give him one of those painkillers.
Shut up and let me think.
It'll be dark in an hour.
Why don't you mind your own business and I'll mind mine?
Fallen leaves decompose and return nutrients to the soil.
...most poignant aspect, I can speak for all our viewers, so, so deeply moved by what you endured.
You are an amazing, inspiring, courageous, beautiful young woman.
I know all our viewers are amazed by the intelligence and poise and endurance and inner strength you displayed during your ordeal.
Truly, an amazing test of character.
And Jack. Your son. By all accounts he is a normal, high-functioning, happy little boy. Amazing.
You made life as normal and nurturing as you could given the environment. You gave him a childhood. How did you manage to do that?
When he's older will you talk to him about his father.
I beg your pardon, are you -
So true, in a very real sense, but the genetic relationship -
You breastfed Jack for five years -
Did it ever occur to you to ask your captor to take Jack away?
To leave him outside a hospital, say, so he'd be found.
So Jack could be free. The ultimate sacrifice, of course, but for him to have a normal childhood...

Do you know how old you are?
No, I meant show me with your fingers how old you are.

Is that her real name, Jack?
Is there another name, after Joy.

Did this Nick guy hurt you?
Jack, when you step out the door -
You don't like to go outside?
Is there daylight in your room?
Then how does the sun come in?
A shed! You're doing great, Jack.
What made you jump out of the truck, Jack?
Control. Listen carefully. South on Maple, three stop signs from the junction with Beach, look for a garden shed with a skylight.

My money's on some kind of cult.

We had to go our different ways. It was what we had to do.
People deal with things in their own way.

Leo's a good guy. Your mother is much happier. It's a good thing.
Lawyer says they are expecting a plea but can't rule out a trial. He wants to get into everything, I said it could wait.

Thank you, yes. I'd like that very much. Scotch... whatever you have.
We don't have to talk about this now.
I can't, I can't... I'm sorry.
What that bastard did to you.
I'm so sorry. I shouldn't be here.
That's OK. Thanks for saving my little girl, Jack.
I hope I didn't forget anything.

I knew you'd come home one day.

Thank you. Thank you so much.
People have been so kind. We won't use it all. Jack, would you like a drink?
I guess it must be in the basement.
Oh no. I've come to love Seamus.

Is there anything you'd like, or like to do?

Hey, maybe tomorrow we can cut that hair. What do you say, Jack?
I'll let you rest. We'll be downstairs.
He had to go home for a while.
I don't think we're ready for talking yet. Not like that.
Maybe it's too much for him right now.
You don't have to do it so soon.
You guys want to start again?
You know, it can be tough to be a Mom. Sometimes it's really tough, and you can get angry, but it doesn't mean you don't love your baby.
I feel like you're impossible to talk to right now.
Tell me and see. I've asked you.
You're my daughter, that's what I'll see.
How can you say that? You think you're the only one whose life was destroyed?
How would you feel if somebody took Jack from you?
Look at him. You should be thinking about him.
Time for you to go upstairs, Jack.
Hi, Jack. I've got someone who wants to talk to you...
Yes we have. We're making cupcakes.
You know how to beat eggs, Jack?
Did you? Wow. What else did you do there.
What did you do in wardrobe?
I know. She just needs to be on her own a little while.
You really want to do that?
I can help you if you'd like.
Okay. Let's do this right. I've wanted to cut that hair a very long time.
I used to cut your mother's hair all the time. And your Grandpa's hair. I've still got it.

And you and me. And you and Leo.
